senses.sense_definition: Relating to or characterized by <w>epanalepsis</w>, a rhetorical figure in which the same word or phrase is repeated at both the beginning and the end of a sentence or clause.

examples.text: The writer employed an <w>epanaleptic</w> structure to emphasize the cyclical nature of the character's journey.
Scholars noted the <w>epanaleptic</w> repetition in the speech, where the opening words were deliberately echoed at the conclusion.
